text: ABS_CALL = call that indicates if the transcript was present (P), absent (A) or marginal (M)
DETECTION P-VALUE = p-value that indicates the significance level of the detection call

protocol.text: Arabidopsis seedlings were infested with Meloidogyne incognita nematodes according to Hammes et al. Plant J. 2006 48:414-426. Briefly, 3 week old Arabidopsis seedlings, 5 per plate, were inoculated with 1,000 M. incognita stage 2 juveniles and placed at an angle in a clear acrylic humid box in a short-day chamber. Twenty-one days after inoculation, root cells undergoing giant cell formation (~5,000,000 um2 area) were captured from infested regions of the root. Giant cells were catapulted using the AutoLPC method directly to P.A.L.M. Adhesive caps.

Arabidopsis seedlings were infested with Meloidogyne incognita nematodes according to Hammes et al. Plant J. 2006 48:414-426. Briefly, 3-week-old Arabidopsis seedlings, 5 per plate, were inoculated with 1,000 M. incognita stage 2 juveniles and placed at an angle in a clear acrylic humid box in a short-day chamber. Fourteen days after inoculation, control root cells not undergoing giant cell formation (~13,000,000 um2 area, ~150 cells) were captured from non-infested regions of the infested root. Control root cells were catapulted using the AutoLPC method directly to P.A.L.M. Adhesive caps.

Total RNA was isolated using the PicoPure RNA isolation kit (Arcturus, Mountain View, CA, USA) with the optional DNase treatment, according to the manufacturer's instructions. RNA was amplified according to NuGEN WT-Ovation Pico kit instructions.
The hybridization mixture was prepared according to NuGEN and Affymetrix procedures and hybridized to GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Arrays.
Data were quantified with the Expression Console (Affymetrix) software application using the MAS5 algorithm.

Arabidopsis seedlings were infested with Meloidogyne incognita nematodes according to Hammes et al. Plant J. 2006 48:414-426. Briefly, 3-week-old Arabidopsis seedlings, 5 per plate, were inoculated with 1,000 M. incognita stage 2 juveniles and placed at an angle in a clear acrylic humid box in a short-day chamber. Fourteen days after inoculation, root cells undergoing giant cell formation (~5,000,000 um2 area, ~80 cells) were captured from infested regions of the root. Giant cells were catapulted using the AutoLPC method directly to P.A.L.M. Adhesive caps.

text: ABS_CALL = call that indicates if the transcript was present (P), absent (A) or marginal (M)
DETECTION P-VALUE = p-value that indicates the significance level of the detection call

protocol.text: Arabidopsis seedlings were infested with Meloidogyne incognita nematodes according to Hammes et al. Plant J. 2006 48:414-426. Briefly, 3 week old Arabidopsis seedlings, 5 per plate, were inoculated with 1,000 M. incognita stage 2 juveniles and placed at an angle in a clear acrylic humid box in a short-day chamber. Twenty-one days after inoculation, control root cells not undergoing giant cell formation (~13,000,000 um2 area) were captured from non-infested regions of the infested root. Control root cells were catapulted using the AutoLPC method directly to P.A.L.M. Adhesive caps.

Arabidopsis seedlings were grown for infestation with Meloidogyne incognita nematodes according to Hammes et al. Plant J. 2006 48:414-426. Briefly, Arabidopsis seeds were sterilized and sown, five seeds per plate, 30 plates total, in a medium containing 2% sucrose, 0.3% Gamborgâ€™s basal salts, and 0.6 % Phytagel, pH 6.1. Plates were placed at a 45o angle in a short-day chamber.
Total RNA amplified according to NuGEN WT-Ovation Pico kit instructions.
Hybridization mixture was prepared according to NuGEN and Affymetrix procedures and hybridized to GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Arrays.
GeneChips were scanned at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine Microarray Facility according to standard manufacturer protocols.
Data were quantified with the Expression Console (Affymetrix) software application using the MAS5 algorithm
